description.narrative:
IOM i Colombia har inkommit med ett förslag till den Svenska Ambassaden i Bogota om stöd för implementeringen av projektet ”Prevention of gender-based violence – second phase”, med 14 440 000 SEK under en treårsperiod.
Det huvudsakliga målet med insatsen är att bidra till implementeringen av fredsavtalet och till före detta kvinnliga Farc-kombattanters ökade politiska, sociala och ekonomiska egenmakt i sin återintegreringsprocess till civila livet. Insatsen inkluderar två specifika områden: 1) förebyggande av könsbaserat våld, och 2) främjande av kvinnors politiska, sociala och ekonomiska autonomi. Detta skall uppnås genom följande resultat: 1) En strategi för förebyggandet av könsbaserat våld implementerat i åtta regioner med deltagandet av 300 kvinnor och men (före detta kombattanter och medlemmar av samhällena) och 100 tjänstemän. 2) Åtta initiativ för ekonomisk egenmakt implementerat med ett jämställdhetsperspektiv. 3) Tre förskolor designade och fungerande som gynnar 90 barn, med deltagandet av 50 kvinnor och män i utvecklandet av handlingsplaner och kapacitetsutvecklande processer i dessa förskolor.

IOM in Colombia has submitted a proposal to the Embassy of Sweden in Bogotá to support the implementation of the project "Prevention of gender-based violence - second phase", with 14 440 000 SEK during a period of three years.
The main objective of the intervention is to contribute to the implementation of the Peace Accord and to the political, social and economic empowerment of former female combatants from Farc in their reincorporation process to civil life. The intervention includes two specific areas: 1) Prevention of gender based violence, and 2) Promotion of women's political, social and economic autonomy. This will be achieved through the following results:
1) A strategy for the prevention of gender based violence implemented in eight regions with the participation of 300 women and men (former combatants and members of the communities) and impacting 100 public servants. 2) Eight economic empowerment initiatives implemented with a gender perspective. 3) Three Care-Centers designed and functioning benefitting 90 children, with the participation of 50 women and men in the elaboration of actions plans and capacity building processes in these centers.

The main objective of the intervention is to contribute to the implementation of the Peace Accord and to the political, social and economic empowerment of former female combatants from FARC in their reincorporation process to civil life. Two specific areas are proposed: 1) Prevention of gender based violence and 2) Promotion of women, political, social and economic autonomy. It is expected that at the end of the project the following results will be achieved: 1) A strategy for the prevention of gender-based violence implemented in eight regions with the participation of 300 women and men (former combatants and members of the communities) impacting 100 public servants. 2) Eight economic empowerment initiatives implemented with a gender perspective, with an impact in the communities. 3) Three Care Centers designed and functioning benefitting 90 children. 50 women and men participate in the elaboration of action plans and capacity building processes for these Care Centers.

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls

tag.narrative: 5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

title.narrative: Agreement Prevention of gender-based violence 2nd phase
Decision on contribution Prevention of gender-based violence 2nd phase

description.narrative:
Some of the main results achieved during this period are: Prevention of gender-based violence: 197 activities implemented within the frame of the gender-based violence prevention programs. The activities included workshops (online), radio programmes, different communication strategies, and handbooks, on issues related with access to justice, gender, care, health and sexual and reproductive rights, human rights, new masculinities and prevention of gender-based violence. 1979 persons participated in these activities. The numbers are higher than the planned target of 300 participants. 61% were women and girls; 39% men and boys. There is an increase in the participation of men and boys in comparison with 2020 (34%). 26% of the participants are former combatants from FARC (301 women and 226 men). 46% belong to the communities (557 women and 352 men) and 7% are relatives to the former combatants (35 men and 97 women). This period shows also an increase in the participation of public servants with a total of 60 persons, reaching 60% of the total outcome expected. After two years of implementation, the prevention of gender-based violence (GBV) programs are a consolidated process in the targeted regions. The participants have the knowledge and tools to have access to the attention routes; they identify the different forms of GBV and they are aware that prevention of GBV is a priority issue for the whole community. They also acknowledge women's central role in the political, economic and social areas.
Economic Empowerment Initiatives The participants in the economic initiatives strengthened their capacities through a process implemented with the support of the National University (Universidad Nacional), which was focused mainly in participative design and design thinking, in the initial planning process. The design of the initiatives were also strengthened with an emphasis in: differentiated approach, environmental sustainibility, do no harm and community perspective. As a result, 9 economic initiatives with the participation of 108 persons (101 women and 7 men) were designed. Through the online event: "VIVAS Creamos", held on October 2021, the initiatives were presented to potential local partners; and a virtual forum (HUBS) was created were information can be found on the different initiatives. These initiatives will be implemented during the third year of the project.
Care Community Centers This component began its activities during this period. Three regions were prioritized based on a selection criteria which included: ongoing activities to establish care centers; conditions and needs identified in the region; possibilities of synergies with governmental entities. Based on this, La Montanita (Caquetá), Tierra Grata (Cesar) and Popayán (Cauca)were selected. Workshops were held for a participative design and analysis of the needs of the regions. 8 trainers and 15 promoters strengthened their capacities on issues related with children's rights; care; human rights; and gender approach. 30 persons from La Montanita (Caquetá) participated in these workshops; 45 persons from Tierra Grata (Cesar) and 15 persons from Popayán (Cauca). Through this process, the participants identified three main issues to be considered in the design of the care centers: 1) the importance of adequate physical places to implement the activities; 2) to broaden the care perspective including elderly persons, persons with disabilities, and the environmental perspective; 3) to develop work plans for the teams implementing the activities.
New Masculinities 45 persons participated in 10 workshops to train trainees on gender transformative programs held by Promundo. These workshops also provided inputs to adapt the Trainer's Guide on Masculinities to the context within reincorporation processes. The guide was finished in 2021 and will be published and implemented in 2022. 2
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
